Carotid duplex ultrasonography is the most appropriate next step in management to evaluate for carotid artery stenosis or occlusion as a potential cause of the patient’s symptoms. Fluorescein angiography is used to evaluate retinal blood flow and is not appropriate for this patient’s presentation.
